pageContext.claim: “If somebody was terminally ill they traveled to Asia, they traveled to Europe, they’d travel all over the world, if they had the money. If they didn't have the money, they’d just go home, there was nothing they could do.”
pageContext.analysis: This is not true. The FDA for years has approved applications from patients seeking access to investigational drugs through the agency’s “expanded access” program; the FDA said it had approved 99 percent of the more than 1,000 annual applications it gets under that program. The "Right to Try" law signed by Trump was a modest improvement.
